name: f18f4
solnTex:
Theorem: a bounded entire function must be constant. In other words, if $f:\mathbb{C}	o\mathbb{C}$ is bounded $(|f(z)|\leq M orall z\in\mathbb{C})$ and holomorphic then $f$ is constant.
Proof: use Cauchy's estimate (just the Cauchy integral formula).
Let $z_0\in\mathbb{C}$. We will show $f'(z_0)=0$. This is for all points, so $f$ must then be constant.
Let $r>0$ and let $\gamma$ be the boundary of the ball centered at $z_0$ of radius $r$, $\gamma(	heta)=z_0+re^{i	heta}$. Because $f$ is entire, $f$ is holomorphic on the ball. By Cauchy's integral formula (extended version with derivatives),
\[f'(z_0)= rac{1}{2\pi i}\int_\gamma rac{f(z)}{(z-z_0)^2}dz.\]
Taking absolute value gives
\[|f'(z_0)|= rac{1}{2\pi}\left|\int_\gamma rac{f(z)}{(z-z_0)^2}dzight|\leq rac{1}{2\pi}\int_\gamma rac{|f(z)|}{|z-z_0|^2}|dz|\]
\[= rac{1}{2\pi}\int_0^{2\pi} rac{|f(z_0+re^{i	heta})|}{|z_0+re^{i	heta}-z_0|^2}|ire^{i	heta}d	heta|= rac{1}{2\pi r}\int_0^{2\pi}|f(z_0+re^{i	heta})|d	heta.\]
By assumption, $|f(z_0+re^{i	heta})|\leq M$, so
\[|f'(z_0)|\leq rac{1}{2\pi r}\int_0^{2\pi}Md	heta= rac{M}{r}.\]
This is true for any $r>0$ because $f$ is entire. Thus $|f'(z_0)|\leq0$, so $f'=0$ as claimed.
